content.location: Odyssey Block main face between Block Party (1 bolt) and Scylla (7 bolts).

content.description: Fabulous arete climb.  There is a loose flake near the top, on the right.
content.location: Arete on the detached huge detached block knowna s Springfield Nuclear.

content.description: Climb the hand/finger crack to join the dihedral, then undercling left to the anchors on Krusty the Clown.
content.location: The corridor is known as Springfield Alley.  Located behind the huge block (Springfield Elementary) in a large left-facing dihedral.

content.description: Climb the shallow left-facing dihedral, then move right onto the face.  A great line that will keep you focused for the routes entirety.
content.location: On the main face of the Odyssey Block.  The arete to the right is Charybdis.  The sport route to the left is Song of the Sirens".

content.description: Discontinuous finger crack.  Be careful with the expanding flake at the top of the crack.  Head right and top out.  Rap from trees.
Mixed line with 3 bolts and anchors.  Start at center of face, then work left to a bolt.
content.location: On the huge block known as Springfield Elementary.  The climb can be found on the face opposite of the alley.
Just right of "Smithers" on the Springfield Nuclear block.
Behind the huge block.  Left of Sideshow Bob.

content.description: This is a really fun route and may be closer to 5.9 than 5.10.  Please add your opinion!  As with all of the routes on these free-standing pillars, please protect the rim ecology by lowering off the anchors and staying off the summit.
content.location: The multi-faceted arete on the right side of the main face.

content.description: This was the first route established on the Odyssey Block.  It was done ground-up without the bolt (which was added later by the FA party to make the route R instead of X).  This is a great line but it's a bit sandbagged and dangerous. Lower from the anchors on Song of the Sirens.
content.protection: 1 bolt, diverse rack, pink tricam, perlon sling, cool head.
content.location: Left-most route on the main face of the Odyssey Block.

content.description: 5 bolts, anchors.  Mixed line with a high first bolt.  Sling flakes to get to the first bolt.
content.location: Shares same start and anchors with Principal Skinner.

content.description: Hard fuzzy face climbing up to a short toothy crack.  This route is more sport than trad but you'll need some cams to keep it safe.
content.protection: 5 bolts, medium cams for the short crack at the top.
content.location: Around the left corner of the main face of the Odyssey Block.

content.description: A hundred feet or two downstream from the giant flake/tunnel. This area is comprised of three huge glorious free standing blocks and a "turret". This is a cool shady place that is good for escaping the heat. The blocks and zig-zag shape of the main wall create a number of shady alleyways with lots of corners and aretes.  The main wall is called Springfield Alley.  The first block encountered is Springfield Elementary, the next block is Springfield Nuclear, and the last block is the Odyssey Block.  The turret jutting out between blocks 2 and 3 is cleverly called The Turret.
